00060 extern char * mech2file(gss_OID mech);
00061 #define SVCGSSD_CONTEXT_CHANNEL "/proc/net/rpc/auth.sptlrpc.context/channel"
00062 #define SVCGSSD_INIT_CHANNEL    "/proc/net/rpc/auth.sptlrpc.init/channel"
00063 
00064 #define TOKEN_BUF_SIZE          8192
00065 
00066 struct svc_cred {
00067         uint32_t cr_remote;
00068         uint32_t cr_usr_root;
00069         uint32_t cr_usr_mds;
00070         uint32_t cr_usr_oss;
00071         uid_t    cr_uid;
00072         uid_t    cr_mapped_uid;
00073         uid_t    cr_gid;
00074 };
00075 
00076 static int
00077 do_svc_downcall(gss_buffer_desc *out_handle, struct svc_cred *cred,
00078                 gss_OID mech, gss_buffer_desc *context_token)
00079 {
00080         FILE *f;
00081         char *fname = NULL;
00082         int err;
00083 
00084         printerr(2, "doing downcall\n");
00085         if ((fname = mech2file(mech)) == NULL)
00086                 goto out_err;
00087         f = fopen(SVCGSSD_CONTEXT_CHANNEL, "w");
00088         if (f == NULL) {
00089                 printerr(0, "WARNING: unable to open downcall channel "
00090                              "%s: %s\n",
00091                              SVCGSSD_CONTEXT_CHANNEL, strerror(errno));
00092                 goto out_err;
00093         }
00094         qword_printhex(f, out_handle->value, out_handle->length);
00095         /* XXX are types OK for the rest of this? */
00096         qword_printint(f, 0x7fffffff); /*XXX need a better timeout */
00097         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_remote);
00098         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_usr_root);
00099         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_usr_mds);
00100         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_usr_oss);
00101         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_mapped_uid);
00102         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_uid);
00103         qword_printint(f, cred->cr_gid);
00104         qword_print(f, fname);
00105         qword_printhex(f, context_token->value, context_token->length);
00106         err = qword_eol(f);
00107         fclose(f);
00108         return err;
00109 out_err:
00110         printerr(0, "WARNING: downcall failed\n");
00111         return -1;
00112 }

00114 struct gss_verifier {
00115         u_int32_t       flav;
00116         gss_buffer_desc body;
00117 };

00119 #define RPCSEC_GSS_SEQ_WIN      5
00120 
00121 static int
00122 send_response(FILE *f, gss_buffer_desc *in_handle, gss_buffer_desc *in_token,
00123               u_int32_t maj_stat, u_int32_t min_stat,
00124               gss_buffer_desc *out_handle, gss_buffer_desc *out_token)
00125 {
00126         char buf[2 * TOKEN_BUF_SIZE];
00127         char *bp = buf;
00128         int blen = sizeof(buf);
00129         /* XXXARG: */
00130         int g;
00131 
00132         printerr(2, "sending null reply\n");
00133 
00134         qword_addhex(&bp, &blen, in_handle->value, in_handle->length);
00135         qword_addhex(&bp, &blen, in_token->value, in_token->length);
00136         qword_addint(&bp, &blen, 0x7fffffff); /*XXX need a better timeout */
00137         qword_adduint(&bp, &blen, maj_stat);
00138         qword_adduint(&bp, &blen, min_stat);
00139         qword_addhex(&bp, &blen, out_handle->value, out_handle->length);
00140         qword_addhex(&bp, &blen, out_token->value, out_token->length);
00141         qword_addeol(&bp, &blen);
00142         if (blen <= 0) {
00143                 printerr(0, "WARNING: send_respsonse: message too long\n");
00144                 return -1;
00145         }
00146         g = open(SVCGSSD_INIT_CHANNEL, O_WRONLY);
00147         if (g == -1) {
00148                 printerr(0, "WARNING: open %s failed: %s\n",
00149                                 SVCGSSD_INIT_CHANNEL, strerror(errno));
00150                 return -1;
00151         }
00152         *bp = '\0';
00153         printerr(3, "writing message: %s", buf);
00154         if (write(g, buf, bp - buf) == -1) {
00155                 printerr(0, "WARNING: failed to write message\n");
00156                 close(g);
00157                 return -1;
00158         }
00159         close(g);
00160         return 0;
00161 }

00165 #define rpc_autherr_rejectedcred        2
00166 #define rpc_autherr_badverf             3
00167 #define rpc_autherr_rejectedverf        4
00168 #define rpc_autherr_tooweak             5
00169 #define rpcsec_gsserr_credproblem       13
00170 #define rpcsec_gsserr_ctxproblem        14

00172 #if 0
00173 static void
00174 add_supplementary_groups(char *secname, char *name, struct svc_cred *cred)
00175 {
00176         int ret;
00177         static gid_t *groups = NULL;
00178 
00179         cred->cr_ngroups = NGROUPS;
00180         ret = nfs4_gss_princ_to_grouplist(secname, name,
00181                         cred->cr_groups, &cred->cr_ngroups);
00182         if (ret < 0) {
00183                 groups = realloc(groups, cred->cr_ngroups*sizeof(gid_t));
00184                 ret = nfs4_gss_princ_to_grouplist(secname, name,
00185                                 groups, &cred->cr_ngroups);
00186                 if (ret < 0)
00187                         cred->cr_ngroups = 0;
00188                 else {
00189                         if (cred->cr_ngroups > NGROUPS)
00190                                 cred->cr_ngroups = NGROUPS;
00191                         memcpy(cred->cr_groups, groups,
00192                                         cred->cr_ngroups*sizeof(gid_t));
00193                 }
00194         }
00195 }

00198 #if 0
00199 static int
00200 get_ids(gss_name_t client_name, gss_OID mech, struct svc_cred *cred)
00201 {
00202         u_int32_t       maj_stat, min_stat;
00203         gss_buffer_desc name;
00204         char            *sname;
00205         int             res = -1;
00206         uid_t           uid, gid;
00207         gss_OID         name_type = GSS_C_NO_OID;
00208         char            *secname;
00209 
00210         maj_stat = gss_display_name(&min_stat, client_name, &name, &name_type);
00211         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00212                 pgsserr("get_ids: gss_display_name",
00213                         maj_stat, min_stat, mech);
00214                 goto out;
00215         }
00216         if (name.length >= 0xffff || /* be certain name.length+1 doesn't overflow */
00217             !(sname = calloc(name.length + 1, 1))) {
00218                 printerr(0, "WARNING: get_ids: error allocating %d bytes "
00219                         "for sname\n", name.length + 1);
00220                 gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &name);
00221                 goto out;
00222         }
00223         memcpy(sname, name.value, name.length);
00224         printerr(1, "sname = %s\n", sname);
00225         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &name);
00226 
00227         res = -EINVAL;
00228         if ((secname = mech2file(mech)) == NULL) {
00229                 printerr(0, "WARNING: get_ids: error mapping mech to "
00230                         "file for name '%s'\n", sname);
00231                 goto out_free;
00232         }
00233         nfs4_init_name_mapping(NULL); /* XXX: should only do this once */
00234         res = nfs4_gss_princ_to_ids(secname, sname, &uid, &gid);
00235         if (res < 0) {
00236                 /*
00237                  * -ENOENT means there was no mapping, any other error
00238                  * value means there was an error trying to do the
00239                  * mapping.
00240                  * If there was no mapping, we send down the value -1
00241                  * to indicate that the anonuid/anongid for the export
00242                  * should be used.
00243                  */
00244                 if (res == -ENOENT) {
00245                         cred->cr_uid = -1;
00246                         cred->cr_gid = -1;
00247                         cred->cr_ngroups = 0;
00248                         res = 0;
00249                         goto out_free;
00250                 }
00251                 printerr(0, "WARNING: get_ids: failed to map name '%s' "
00252                         "to uid/gid: %s\n", sname, strerror(-res));
00253                 goto out_free;
00254         }
00255         cred->cr_uid = uid;
00256         cred->cr_gid = gid;
00257         add_supplementary_groups(secname, sname, cred);
00258         res = 0;
00259 out_free:
00260         free(sname);
00261 out:
00262         return res;
00263 }
00264 #endif

00266 #if 0
00267 void
00268 print_hexl(int pri, unsigned char *cp, int length)
00269 {
00270         int i, j, jm;
00271         unsigned char c;
00272 
00273         printerr(pri, "length %d\n",length);
00274         printerr(pri, "\n");
00275 
00276         for (i = 0; i < length; i += 0x10) {
00277                 printerr(pri, "  %04x: ", (unsigned int)i);
00278                 jm = length - i;
00279                 jm = jm > 16 ? 16 : jm;
00280 
00281                 for (j = 0; j < jm; j++) {
00282                         if ((j % 2) == 1)
00283                                 printerr(pri, "%02x ", (unsigned int)cp[i+j]);
00284                         else
00285                                 printerr(pri, "%02x", (unsigned int)cp[i+j]);
00286                 }
00287                 for (; j < 16; j++) {
00288                         if ((j % 2) == 1)
00289                                 printerr(pri,"   ");
00290                         else
00291                                 printerr(pri,"  ");
00292                 }
00293                 printerr(pri," ");
00294 
00295                 for (j = 0; j < jm; j++) {
00296                         c = cp[i+j];
00297                         c = isprint(c) ? c : '.';
00298                         printerr(pri,"%c", c);
00299                 }
00300                 printerr(pri,"\n");
00301         }
00302 }
00303 #endif
00304 
00305 static int
00306 get_ids(gss_name_t client_name, gss_OID mech, struct svc_cred *cred,
00307         lnet_nid_t nid, uint32_t lustre_svc)
00308 {
00309         u_int32_t       maj_stat, min_stat;
00310         gss_buffer_desc name;
00311         char            *sname, *host, *realm;
00312         const int       namebuf_size = 512;
00313         char            namebuf[namebuf_size];
00314         int             res = -1;
00315         gss_OID         name_type = GSS_C_NO_OID;
00316         struct passwd   *pw;
00317 
00318         cred->cr_remote = 0;
00319         cred->cr_usr_root = cred->cr_usr_mds = cred->cr_usr_oss = 0;
00320         cred->cr_uid = cred->cr_mapped_uid = cred->cr_gid = -1;
00321 
00322         maj_stat = gss_display_name(&min_stat, client_name, &name, &name_type);
00323         if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00324                 pgsserr("get_ids: gss_display_name",
00325                         maj_stat, min_stat, mech);
00326                 return -1;
00327         }
00328         if (name.length >= 0xffff || /* be certain name.length+1 doesn't overflow */
00329             !(sname = calloc(name.length + 1, 1))) {
00330                 printerr(0, "WARNING: get_ids: error allocating %zu bytes "
00331                         "for sname\n", name.length + 1);
00332                 gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &name);
00333                 return -1;
00334         }
00335         memcpy(sname, name.value, name.length);
00336         sname[name.length] = '\0';
00337         gss_release_buffer(&min_stat, &name);
00338 
00339         if (lustre_svc == LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_MDS)
00340                 lookup_mapping(sname, nid, &cred->cr_mapped_uid);
00341         else
00342                 cred->cr_mapped_uid = -1;
00343 
00344         realm = strchr(sname, '@');
00345         if (realm) {
00346                 *realm++ = '\0';
00347         } else {
00348                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s has no realm name\n", sname);
00349                 goto out_free;
00350         }
00351 
00352         host = strchr(sname, '/');
00353         if (host)
00354                 *host++ = '\0';
00355 
00356         if (strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_MGS) == 0) {
00357                 printerr(0, "forbid %s as a user name\n", sname);
00358                 goto out_free;
00359         }
00360 
00361         /* 1. check host part */
00362         if (host) {
00363                 if (lnet_nid2hostname(nid, namebuf, namebuf_size)) {
00364                         printerr(0, "ERROR: failed to resolve hostname for "
00365                                  "%s/%s@%s from %016llx\n",
00366                                  sname, host, realm, nid);
00367                         goto out_free;
00368                 }
00369 
00370                 if (strcasecmp(host, namebuf)) {
00371                         printerr(0, "ERROR: %s/%s@%s claimed hostname doesn't "
00372                                  "match %s, nid %016llx\n", sname, host, realm,
00373                                  namebuf, nid);
00374                         goto out_free;
00375                 }
00376         } else {
00377                 if (!strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_MDS) ||
00378                     !strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_OSS)) {
00379                         printerr(0, "ERROR: %s@%s from %016llx doesn't "
00380                                  "bind with hostname\n", sname, realm, nid);
00381                         goto out_free;
00382                 }
00383         }
00384 
00385         /* 2. check realm and user */
00386         switch (lustre_svc) {
00387         case LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_MDS:
00388                 if (strcasecmp(mds_local_realm, realm)) {
00389                         cred->cr_remote = 1;
00390 
00391                         /* only allow mapped user from remote realm */
00392                         if (cred->cr_mapped_uid == -1) {
00393                                 printerr(0, "ERROR: %s%s%s@%s from %016llx "
00394                                          "is remote but without mapping\n",
00395                                          sname, host ? "/" : "",
00396                                          host ? host : "", realm, nid);
00397                                 break;
00398                         }
00399                 } else {
00400                         if (!strcmp(sname, LUSTRE_ROOT_NAME)) {
00401                                 cred->cr_uid = 0;
00402                                 cred->cr_usr_root = 1;
00403                         } else if (!strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_MDS)) {
00404                                 cred->cr_uid = 0;
00405                                 cred->cr_usr_mds = 1;
00406                         } else if (!strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_OSS)) {
00407                                 cred->cr_uid = 0;
00408                                 cred->cr_usr_oss = 1;
00409                         } else {
00410                                 pw = getpwnam(sname);
00411                                 if (pw != NULL) {
00412                                         cred->cr_uid = pw->pw_uid;
00413                                         printerr(2, "%s resolve to uid %u\n",
00414                                                  sname, cred->cr_uid);
00415                                 } else if (cred->cr_mapped_uid != -1) {
00416                                         printerr(2, "user %s from %016llx is "
00417                                                  "mapped to %u\n", sname, nid,
00418                                                  cred->cr_mapped_uid);
00419                                 } else {
00420                                         printerr(0, "ERROR: invalid user, "
00421                                                  "%s/%s@%s from %016llx\n",
00422                                                  sname, host, realm, nid);
00423                                         break;
00424                                 }
00425                         }
00426                 }
00427 
00428                 res = 0;
00429                 break;
00430         case LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_MGS:
00431                 if (!strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_OSS)) {
00432                         cred->cr_uid = 0;
00433                         cred->cr_usr_oss = 1;
00434                 }
00435                 /* fall through */
00436         case LUSTRE_GSS_SVC_OSS:
00437                 if (!strcmp(sname, LUSTRE_ROOT_NAME)) {
00438                         cred->cr_uid = 0;
00439                         cred->cr_usr_root = 1;
00440                 } else if (!strcmp(sname, GSSD_SERVICE_MDS)) {
00441                         cred->cr_uid = 0;
00442                         cred->cr_usr_mds = 1;
00443                 }
00444                 if (cred->cr_uid == -1) {
00445                         printerr(0, "ERROR: svc %d doesn't accept user %s "
00446                                  "from %016llx\n", lustre_svc, sname, nid);
00447                         break;
00448                 }
00449                 res = 0;
00450                 break;
00451         default:
00452                 assert(0);
00453         }
00454 
00455 out_free:
00456         if (!res)
00457                 printerr(1, "%s: authenticated %s%s%s@%s from %016llx\n",
00458                          lustre_svc_name[lustre_svc], sname,
00459                          host ? "/" : "", host ? host : "", realm, nid);
00460         free(sname);
00461         return res;
00462 }
00463 
00464 typedef struct gss_union_ctx_id_t {
00465         gss_OID         mech_type;
00466         gss_ctx_id_t    internal_ctx_id;
00467 } gss_union_ctx_id_desc, *gss_union_ctx_id_t;
00468 
00469 /*
00470  * return -1 only if we detect error during reading from upcall channel,
00471  * all other cases return 0.
00472  */
00473 int
00474 handle_nullreq(FILE *f) {
00475         uint64_t                handle_seq;
00476         char                    in_tok_buf[TOKEN_BUF_SIZE];
00477         char                    in_handle_buf[15];
00478         char                    out_handle_buf[15];
00479         gss_buffer_desc         in_tok = {.value = in_tok_buf},
00480                                 out_tok = {.value = NULL},
00481                                 in_handle = {.value = in_handle_buf},
00482                                 out_handle = {.value = out_handle_buf},
00483                                 ctx_token = {.value = NULL},
00484                                 ignore_out_tok = {.value = NULL},
00485         /* XXX isn't there a define for this?: */
00486                                 null_token = {.value = NULL};
00487         uint32_t                lustre_svc;
00488         lnet_nid_t              nid;
00489         u_int32_t               ret_flags;
00490         gss_ctx_id_t            ctx = GSS_C_NO_CONTEXT;
00491         gss_name_t              client_name;
00492         gss_OID                 mech = GSS_C_NO_OID;
00493         gss_cred_id_t           svc_cred;
00494         u_int32_t               maj_stat = GSS_S_FAILURE, min_stat = 0;
00495         u_int32_t               ignore_min_stat;
00496         int                     get_len;
00497         struct svc_cred         cred;
00498         static char             *lbuf = NULL;
00499         static int              lbuflen = 0;
00500         static char             *cp;
00501 
00502         printerr(2, "handling null request\n");
00503 
00504         if (readline(fileno(f), &lbuf, &lbuflen) != 1) {
00505                 printerr(0, "WARNING: handle_nullreq: "
00506                             "failed reading request\n");
00507                 return -1;
00508         }
00509 
00510         cp = lbuf;
00511 
00512         qword_get(&cp, (char *) &lustre_svc, sizeof(lustre_svc));
00513         qword_get(&cp, (char *) &nid, sizeof(nid));
00514         qword_get(&cp, (char *) &handle_seq, sizeof(handle_seq));
00515         printerr(2, "handling req: svc %u, nid %016llx, idx %"PRIx64"\n",
00516                  lustre_svc, nid, handle_seq);
00517 
00518         get_len = qword_get(&cp, in_handle.value, sizeof(in_handle_buf));
00519         if (get_len < 0) {
00520                 printerr(0, "WARNING: handle_nullreq: "
00521                             "failed parsing request\n");
00522                 goto out_err;
00523         }
00524         in_handle.length = (size_t)get_len;
00525 
00526         printerr(3, "in_handle:\n");
00527         print_hexl(3, in_handle.value, in_handle.length);
00528 
00529         get_len = qword_get(&cp, in_tok.value, sizeof(in_tok_buf));
00530         if (get_len < 0) {
00531                 printerr(0, "WARNING: handle_nullreq: "
00532                             "failed parsing request\n");
00533                 goto out_err;
00534         }
00535         in_tok.length = (size_t)get_len;
00536 
00537         printerr(3, "in_tok:\n");
00538         print_hexl(3, in_tok.value, in_tok.length);
00539 
00540         if (in_handle.length != 0) { /* CONTINUE_INIT case */
00541                 if (in_handle.length != sizeof(ctx)) {
00542                         printerr(0, "WARNING: handle_nullreq: "
00543                                     "input handle has unexpected length %zu\n",
00544                                     in_handle.length);
00545                         goto out_err;
00546                 }
00547                 /* in_handle is the context id stored in the out_handle
00548                  * for the GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED case below.  */
00549                 memcpy(&ctx, in_handle.value, in_handle.length);
00550         }
00551 
00552         svc_cred = gssd_select_svc_cred(lustre_svc);
00553         if (!svc_cred) {
00554                 printerr(0, "no service credential for svc %u\n", lustre_svc);
00555                 goto out_err;
00556         }
00557 
00558         maj_stat = gss_accept_sec_context(&min_stat, &ctx, svc_cred,
00559                         &in_tok, GSS_C_NO_CHANNEL_BINDINGS, &client_name,
00560                         &mech, &out_tok, &ret_flags, NULL, NULL);
00561 
00562         if (maj_stat == GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED) {
00563                 printerr(1, "gss_accept_sec_context GSS_S_CONTINUE_NEEDED\n");
00564 
00565                 /* Save the context handle for future calls */
00566                 out_handle.length = sizeof(ctx);
00567                 memcpy(out_handle.value, &ctx, sizeof(ctx));
00568                 goto continue_needed;
00569         }
00570         else if (maj_stat != GSS_S_COMPLETE) {
00571                 printerr(0, "WARNING: gss_accept_sec_context failed\n");
00572                 pgsserr("handle_nullreq: gss_accept_sec_context",
00573                         maj_stat, min_stat, mech);
00574                 goto out_err;
00575         }
00576 
00577         if (get_ids(client_name, mech, &cred, nid, lustre_svc)) {
00578                 /* get_ids() prints error msg */
00579                 maj_stat = GSS_S_BAD_NAME; /* XXX ? */
00580                 gss_release_name(&ignore_min_stat, &client_name);
00581                 goto out_err;
00582         }
00583         gss_release_name(&ignore_min_stat, &client_name);
00584 
00585         /* Context complete. Pass handle_seq in out_handle to use
00586          * for context lookup in the kernel. */
00587         out_handle.length = sizeof(handle_seq);
00588         memcpy(out_handle.value, &handle_seq, sizeof(handle_seq));
00589 
00590         /* kernel needs ctx to calculate verifier on null response, so
00591          * must give it context before doing null call: */
00592         if (serialize_context_for_kernel(ctx, &ctx_token, mech)) {
00593                 printerr(0, "WARNING: handle_nullreq: "
00594                             "serialize_context_for_kernel failed\n");
00595                 maj_stat = GSS_S_FAILURE;
00596                 goto out_err;
00597         }
00598         /* We no longer need the gss context */
00599         gss_delete_sec_context(&ignore_min_stat, &ctx, &ignore_out_tok);
00600 
00601         do_svc_downcall(&out_handle, &cred, mech, &ctx_token);
00602 continue_needed:
00603         send_response(f, &in_handle, &in_tok, maj_stat, min_stat,
00604                         &out_handle, &out_tok);
00605 out:
00606         if (ctx_token.value != NULL)
00607                 free(ctx_token.value);
00608         if (out_tok.value != NULL)
00609                 gss_release_buffer(&ignore_min_stat, &out_tok);
00610         return 0;
00611 
00612 out_err:
00613         if (ctx != GSS_C_NO_CONTEXT)
00614                 gss_delete_sec_context(&ignore_min_stat, &ctx, &ignore_out_tok);
00615         send_response(f, &in_handle, &in_tok, maj_stat, min_stat,
00616                         &null_token, &null_token);
00617         goto out;
00618 }
Generated on Sun Jun 5 20:55:36 2016 for Lustre by doxygen 1.6.1
